comments.body: nit: `onChanged` is called on user text input (it won't fire if you change `TextEditingController.value` programmatically).

Generally we start the documentation with a single sentence summary (e.g., "Controls the text being edited.") and dartdoc will make use of that: https://master-api.flutter.dev/flutter/cupertino/CupertinoTextField-class.html. See: https://dart.dev/guides/language/effective-dart/documentation#do-start-doc-comments-with-a-single-sentence-summary and https://dart.dev/guides/language/effective-dart/documentation#do-separate-the-first-sentence-of-a-doc-comment-into-its-own-paragraph
does it look better now after my changes?
